definition: (degree adverb used before a noun phrase) for all practical purposes but not completely, a great amount or extent, (quantifier used with mass nouns) great in quantity or degree or extent
details:
adverb
- (degree adverb used before a noun phrase) for all practical purposes but not completely
= example: (degree adverb used before a noun phrase) for all practical purposes but not completely
= synonyms: practically
- very, particularly
= example: very, particularly
= synonyms: most
- to a great degree or extent
= example: to a great degree or extent
- to a very great degree or extent
= synonyms: a lot, lots, a good deal, a great deal
- frequently or in great quantities
= example: frequently or in great quantities
= synonyms: often, a great deal
noun
- a great amount or extent
= example: a great amount or extent
adjective
- (quantifier used with mass nouns) great in quantity or degree or extent
